memberdef.argsstring: (float32 ***arr, uint32 d1, uint32 d2, uint32 d3)
memberdef.name: norm_3d

briefdescription.para: Ensures that non-zero values x such that -band < x < band, band > 0 are set to -band if x < 0 and band if x > 0.
Calculate the determinant of a positive definite matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The input matrix, must be positive definite.
The dimension of the input matrix.

simplesect.para: The determinant of the input matrix, or -1.0 if the matrix is not positive definite.
These can be vanishingly small hence the float64 return type. Also note that only the upper triangular portion of a is considered, therefore the check for positive-definiteness is not reliable.

briefdescription.para: Invert (if possible) a positive definite matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The inverse of a will be stored here.
The input matrix, must be positive definite.
The dimension of the input matrix.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or -1 for a non-positive-definite matrix.
Only the upper triangular portion of a is considered, therefore the check for positive-definiteness is not reliable.

briefdescription.para: Solve (if possible) a positive-definite system of linear equations AX=B for X.

parameterdescription.para: The A matrix on the left-hand side of the equation, must be positive-definite.
The B vector on the right-hand side of the equation.
The X vector will be stored here.
The dimension of the A matrix (n by n) and the B and X vectors.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or -1 for a non-positive-definite matrix.
Only the upper triangular portion of a is considered, therefore the check for positive-definiteness is not reliable.

briefdescription.para: Multiply C=AB where A and B are symmetric matrices.
Calculate the outer product of two vectors.

parameterdescription.para: A (pre-allocated) len x len array. The outer product will be stored here.
The length of the input vectors.

briefdescription.para: Multiply a symmetric matrix by a constant in-place.

parameterdescription.para: The constant to multiply it by.
The B matrix to add to A.
